Thinking back to the once every four years

arms closer towards their body and with that

What they’re doing is reducing the moment
of inertia in order to increase angular velocity.

Simplified, as the mass of an object is moved
closer to the axis, it becomes easier to rotate.

This is also why divers go into the tuck position
when performing somersaults—it makes it

easier to rotate—but since it’s easier
to rotate when mass is closer to the axis

that also means the opposite is true—it’s
harder to rotate when mass is further from
the axis.

rotation.
